title: Executive Order 8830-Withdrawing Public Lands for Use of the War Department as a Training Center
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me as President of the United States, it is ordered that, subject to valid existing rights, the following-described public lands be, and they are hereby, withdrawn from all forms of appropriation under the public-land laws, including the mining laws, and reserved for the use of the War Department as a training center:
T. 23 S., R. 7 E., sec. 16, lot 3;

T. 24 S., R. 7 E.,          sec. 30, lots 11, 12, SW¼SE¼;     sec. 31, lots 1, 2, SW¼NE¼;     sec. 32, NE¼;     sec. 33, lots 1, 2, 3, 8, SE¼NE¼, W½NE¼, NW¼;     sec. 34, SW¼NE¼, SW¼NW¼, SW¼, NW¼SE¼, S½SE¼;
T. 23 S., R. 8 E.,     sec. 32, lots 4, 5;     sec. 36, lot 4;

T. 24 S., R. 8 E.,     sec. 19, SE¼SW¼;     sec. 30, lots 2, 3, 4, E½W½, SE¼;     sec. 31, lot 1, NE¼, E½NW¼, N½SE¼, SE¼SE¼;     sec. 32, SE¼W¼ W½NW¼, S½;     sec. 33, SW¼SW¼;containing 2623.46 acres.
This order shall take precedence over, but shall not rescind or revoke, Executive Order No. 6910 of November 26, 1934, as amended, so far as such order affects the above-described lands.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8830-Withdrawing Public Lands for Use of the War Department as a Training Center Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372214
